name: Albert Ho Chun-yan
status: Currently in jail. A total of 18 months imprisonment
summary: Albert Ho is a solicitor and was a founding member of the Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China and the Democratic Party. He also served as a member of Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 1998-2016.

zh_HK.name: 何俊仁
zh_HK.summary: 何俊仁，廣東中山人，成長於香港，曾任支聯會主席，屯門區議會樂翠前區議員、民主黨前主席、前香港立法會議員，而他亦執業律師，畢業於香港大學法律系。何與李卓人梁國雄和黎智英等十名民主派人士，多次遊行活動，被控煽惑他人參與及組織未經批准集結等罪，何遭重判入獄。2021年9月香港國安處以《港區國安法》「煽動他人顛覆國家政權罪」起訴香港支聯會及其正副主席包括何俊仁

name: Cyd Ho Sau-lan
status: Currently in jail. A total of 14 months imprisonment
summary: Cyd Ho was a founding member of the Labour Party and currently serves as Vice-Chairperson. She also served as a member of Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 1998-2004 and 2008-2016.

zh_HK.summary: 香港立法會議員（1998－2004、2008－2016），中西區觀龍選區區議員（2004-2007）。在任議員期間，擔任泛民會議召集人多年。

name: Jimmy Lai Chee-ying
title: Founder, Next Digital Limited
status: Currently in jail. A total of 20 months imprisonment
summary: Jimmy Lai is an internationally-respected entrepreneur and a leading campaigner for democracy and human rights in Hong Kong. He is the founder of Giordano, one of Asia's largest clothing retailers and Next Media, the largest listed media company in Hong Kong, which published, among other titles, the Apple Daily, the only Chinese-language mass circulation pro-democracy daily newspaper until its forced closure in June 2021.

He also took up leading roles in the Hong Kong Confederation of Trade Unions and the Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China. Lee was also a member of the Legislative Council from 1998-2016.

zh_HK.summary: 香港立法會議員（1995年－2016年）、前職工盟秘書長、工黨副主席，前支聯會主席。香港大學土木工程系畢業。

name: Leung Kwok-hung
title: Former member, Hong Kong Legislative Council
status: Currently in jail. A total of 23 months imprisonment
summary: Leung Kwok-hung co-founded the League of Social Democrats in 2006 and served as a member of the Legislative Council from 2004-2016. He was disqualified from his position in 2016 over oath-taking procedures.

title: Former member, Hong Kong Legislative Council
status: Currently in jail for a total of 9 months imprisonment
summary: Leung Yiu-chung has served as a member of the Kwai Tsing District Council since 1985, and served as a member of Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 1998-2020.

zh_HK.name: 梁耀忠
zh_HK.summary: 前任香港立法會區議會（第二）功能界別議員，曾任香港葵青區議會葵芳選區議員長達36年。

name: Au Nok-hin
status: Currently in jail. A total of 10 months imprisonment
summary: Au Nok-hin served as District Councillor for Lei Tung from 2012-2019, and a member of the Legislative Council from 2018-2019. He also served as the convenor of the Civil Human Rights Front from 2016-2017.

charges.charge: Organizing and participating in an unauthorized assembly
charges.incident: Causeway Bay march on 18 August 2019

charges.charge: Assaulting two police officers
charges.incident: Mong Kok protest on Jul 2019
charges.sentencing: 9 weeks imprisonment (after the government appealed against the community service order he was originally given)

charges.charge: National Security Law - Subversion of state
charges.incident: promoting primary elections on social media between July 2019 and January 2021

zh_HK.name: 區諾軒
zh_HK.summary: 前香港南區區議會利東一選區議員，前香港立法會議員（香港島，被法院裁定在補選中並非妥為當選而取消資格），香港中文大學、香港城市大學專上學院社會科學部客席講師。他曾經是立法會內最年輕議員。

name: Benny Tai Yiu-ting
title: Former University of Hong Kong law professor
summary: Benny Tai was the co-founder of the 2014 Occupy Central Movement and a leading strategist for the pro-democracy camp in Hong Kong. He was a key organiser of an election primary for the Hong Kong’s opposition parties in 2019. He was previously granted a cash bail of HK$100,000 after serving 4 months of his 16-month sentence over the 2014 protests. While awaiting the outcome of the appeal against his conviction and prison sentence related to the 2014 protests, he was placed in custody in March 2021. He was one of the 47 activists charged with “subversion of state” for organizing the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020. On 30 April 2021, Tai lost his appeal to overturn a prison sentence of 16 months and eight months and began to serve his sentence in jail.

charges.charge: Four charges of illegal election spending under the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance
charges.incident: Placing advertisements in local newspapers in the run-up to the 2016 legislative polls

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organizing and coordinating Hong Kong pro-democracy primary elections (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 戴耀廷
zh_HK.title: 香港法學學者，政治人物，曾任香港大學法律學院副院長和副教授。
zh_HK.summary: 戴耀廷於2013年提出以「讓愛與和平佔領中環」而聞名，他認為香港若未能有「真正普選」，應該參與佔領行動以爭取2017年香港行政長官選舉得以有「真正選擇」。

name: Ben Chung Kam-lun
title: Former chairman and member, District Council; Former vice convenor, Power for Democracy (disbanded); Former founding member, Neo Democrats
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Ben Chung joined the Democratic Party in 2011 but left with Gary Fan, Sai Kung District Councillor, over the party's deal with the Beijing authorities in the 2012 constitutional reform proposal and co-founded Neo Democrats. He was re-elected in 2015 and has been serving as the Chairman of the Sai Kung District Council since 2020.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: Organizing and coordinating Hong Kong pro-democracy primary elections (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 鍾錦麟
zh_HK.summary: 前香港西貢區議會主席兼欣英選區議員。現為獨立民主派人士，新民主同盟前成員，亦為新民主同盟創黨成員、民主黨前成員。

name: Dr. Andrew Chiu Ka-yin
title: Member, District Council; Former member, Democratic Party; Former convenor, Power for Democracy (disbanded)
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Dr. Andrew Chiu has been serving as a member of the Eastern District Council for Tai Koo Shing West since 2008. He is also a member of the Democratic Party, strategy committee member of the Professional Commons, and chairperson of Hong Kong Society of Accredited Mediators. He was the second coordinator of the primary poll.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organizing and coordinating Hong Kong pro-democracy primary elections (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 趙家賢
zh_HK.summary: 前香港東區區議會副主席兼前太古城西選區議員，是公民教育委員會委員、平和基金諮詢委員會委員、資深認可調解員、仲裁員、民主派協調組織民主動力召集人、香港認可調解員學會主席、公共專業聯盟董事會成員及香港民主黨成員。

name: Gordon Ng Ching-hang
title: Pro-democracy activist
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Ng Ching-hang, who goes by the pseudonym Lee Bak Lou on LIHKG, initiated a petition to affect voter sentiment. Ng also transferred HK$135,000 to Apple Daily for a front-page advert on 3 July 2020 promoting the primaries.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organizing and coordinating in unofficial pro-democracy primary elections (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 吳政亨
zh_HK.summary: 又名李伯盧, 是香港民主運動人士。吳政亨是初選47人案唯一的無黨派被告，根據國家安全法被控串謀顛覆國家政權罪，目前已被拘留。

name: Owen Chow
title: Elected candidate in New Territories East region at the 2020 democratic primaries
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Chow along with 54 other pro-democracy candidates was arrested for organizing and participating in the democratic primaries. 47 of them were charged with subversion under the National Security Law. He was detained in prison until June 22, 2021, when he was granted bail to finish his nursing degree. However, on Jan. 12, 2022, Chow was re-arrested following a court ruling that he had broken his bail conditions for posting materials endangering national security which related to the 2019 Price Edward station attack and the 2019 Yuen Long attack

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organizing and coordinating in unofficial pro-democracy primary elections (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 鄒家成
zh_HK.summary: 2021年2月28日，他與另外46人被警方以「串謀顛覆國家政權」的罪名正式起訴，被國安法指定法官拒絕保釋，還押至6月22日，其後獲高等法院批准保釋。直至2022年1月12日因保釋期間發佈的Facebook帖文被認為危害國家安全及違反法庭保釋條件再次被捕並被撤銷保釋再度還押。

name: Claudia Mo Man-ching
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Claudia Mo is a former journalist and a member of Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 2012-2020 representing the Kowloon West constituency. She was a member of the Civic Party from 2006-2016 and founded the localist group Hong Kong First in 2013. She was one of the 47 arrestees under the National Security Law for “subversion of state” over their participation in the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020. She has been detained since February 2020 and her bail application was denied in April 2021.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Subversion of state
charges.incident: “35+” democratic primaries (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 毛孟靜
zh_HK.summary: 香港傳媒工作者，民主派政治人物，現為香港中文大學政治與行政學系兼任講師，曾任香港九龍西選區立法會議員及民主派會議召集人，前公民黨成員。

name: Jeremy Tam Man-ho
status: Currently remanded in custody; bail denied
summary: Jeremy Tam was a pilot before becoming a politician. He was the Vice-Chairperson of the Civic Party’s Kowloon East branch and served in Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 2016-2020, representing the Kowloon East constituency. Tam resigned alongside other 14 pro-democracy legislators in November 2020 in response to Beijing’s decision of unseating four democratic lawmakers. He was arrested in January 2021 for his participation in the “35+” democratic primaries last year and was rejected bail in April 2021.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Subversion of state
charges.incident: “35+” democratic primaries (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 譚文豪
zh_HK.summary: 前立法會議員（九龍東），離任後與黨友林瑞華合夥經營旺角茶餐廳「一日三餐」，前公民黨外務副主席。

name: Joshua Wong Chi-fung
title: Activist; Former secretary-general, Demosisto (disbanded); Founding member, Scholarism (disbanded)
status: Currently in jail. A total of 23.5 months of imprisonment
summary: Joshua Wong was one of the leaders of Hong Kong’s 2014 student-led ‘Umbrella Movement’ in which roads in the heart of the financial hub in the city were blocked for 79 days. Wong was 17 years old at the time. In 2012, Wong, aged 15, formed a student activist group called ‘Scholarism’ (disbanded) together with activists Agnes Chow and Oscar Lai. In the same year, Wong rallied more than 100,000 people to protest against the Hong Kong government’s plans to implement mandatory 'national education' in schools. Wong was nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize in 2018 for his role in the Umbrella Movement. He was among the 12 opposition candidates who were running in Hong Kong Council Elections which were to be held in September 2019. The elections were postponed due to Covid-19. In July 2020, he won in his district in an unofficial primary election organised by the pro-democracy camp in Hong Kong.

charges.charge: Organizing and inciting others to take part in an unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: Protest outside the Wan Chai Police Station in June 2019

charges.charge: Taking part in an unauthorized assembly and violating the anti-mask law by wearing face covering at the assembly
charges.incident: Causeway Bay protest in October 2019

charges.charge: Participating in an unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Candlelight Vigil on 4 June 2020
charges.sentencing: 10 months imprisonment and then reduced to 8 months imprisonment after appeal

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: “35+” democratic primaries (July 2020)

zh_HK.name: 黃之鋒
zh_HK.summary: 香港民主自決派社運人士，曾先後任學民思潮召集人、香港眾志秘書長。2011年，14歲時他創立學民思潮及組織社會運動，批評政府想透過新設的德育及國民教育科向學生洗腦，並帶領群眾成功逼使政府取消推行有關課程而聞名於香港。2014年他因參與雨傘運動被美國《時代雜誌》選為全球25位最具影響力少年。2018年獲美國參議員提名競逐諾貝爾和平獎。

name: Tam Tak Chi
summary: Tam Tak Chi is vice-president of the People Power party and a former radio host. He took a leading supporting role in the 2014 Occupy Central movement. He won an unofficial primary poll organised by the opposition to select candidates for the Legislative Council vote in Hong Kong in July 2020. He faced 14 charges, including uttering seditious words, disorderly conduct in a public place, conspiracy to utter seditious words, holding or convening an unauthorised assembly, incitement to knowingly take part in an unauthorised assembly, and refusing to obey an order from an authorised officer. Tam’s defence counsel Philip Dykes SC argued that the eight sedition charges were unconstitutional as they were inconsistent with the Basic Law, the city’s mini-constitution, and the Hong Kong Bill of Rights.

charges.charge: found guilty at the District Court of 11 charges, including 'uttering seditious words,' 'holding or convening an unauthorised assembly,' 'incitement to knowingly take part in an unauthorised assembly' and 'refusing to obey an order given by an authorised officer.' He was acquitted of two charges of “disorderly conduct in a public place,” and one count of “conspiracy to utter seditious words.”

zh_HK.name: 譚得志 (快必)
zh_HK.summary: 香港電台節目主持，畢業於香港大學中文系，香港中文大學崇基學院修讀神學。譚得志後來投身社會運動，以對抗保守的基督教和親建制勢力。2013年曾加入人民力量，曾參與雨傘運動和2015年香港區議會選舉，並為前人民力量副主席。由於涉嫌違反港區國安法，自2020年9月開始一直還押至今。

name: Tiffany Yuen Ka-wai
summary: Tiffany Yuen was the Vice Chairperson of Demosisto before quitting the party in 2018. She has been serving as the District Councillor of the Tin Wan District since 2020. She participated in the “35+” democratic primaries to represent the democratic camp in the Hong Kong Island constituency.

charges.charge: Knowingly participating in an unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Candlelight Vigil (4 June 2020)

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: Organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 袁嘉蔚
zh_HK.summary: 綽號「田灣女孩」，香港民主派政治家，南區萬事屋成員，香港眾志前副主席，曾任南區區議會田灣選區議員、社區參與事務委員會主席、南區平等機會工作小組主席、南區復康活動及長者友善社區工作小組副主席。

name: Andy Chui Tsz-kin
summary: Andy Chui founded the “Umbrella Fathers and Mothers” during the Umbrella Movement in 2014 and won the District Council election in 2015. He started serving as a District Councillor representing the Yue Wan constituency since 2016. Andy has been detained since February 2020 and his bail application was denied by High Court Justice Esther Toh in April 2020.

charges.charge: Organising unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: Protest against the national security law on July 1 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 徐子見
zh_HK.summary: 香港民主派人士，柴灣起動召集人，前香港東區區議會漁灣選區議員。他於2015年香港區議會選舉擊敗競逐連任的時任立法會議員、民建聯成員鍾樹根而當選。

name: Fergus Leung Fong-wai
summary: Fergus Leung Fong-wai is a Hong Kong politician formerly serving as a member of the Central and Western District Council, representing Kwun Lung. Leung ran as an independent localist in the 2019 District Council elections and won his seat with 50.69% of the vote. He participated in the “35+” democratic primaries, running to represent the democratic camp in the Hong Kong Island constituency.

charges.charge: National Security Law - conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 梁晃維
zh_HK.summary: 香港大學生物醫學系學生，前香港中西區區議會觀龍選區議員，前香港大學學生會外務秘書及時事委員會主席。2021年因初選47人案，梁晃維被控「串謀顛覆國家政權」遭還押至今，不得保釋；其後辭去區議員職務。

name: Lam Cheuk-ting
title: Former member, Hong Kong Legislative Council; Former member, Democratic Party
summary: Lam was a senior figure in the Democratic Party. His political career started in 1999 when he joined the Party and became assistant of former Hong Kong lawmaker Albert Ho. He left the party in 2006 to join the Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) as an investigator and he returned to the Democratic Party as chief executive in 2011. In the mob attack that took place inside Yuen Long train station on 21 July 2019, Lam suffered an injury to his mouth that required 18 stitches while he was filming the incident but later on was arrested for rioting. He was prosecuted by the Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) for allegedly disclosing the personal information of individuals being investigated by police in relation to the Yuen Long mob attacks in July 2019. He pleaded not guilty on 27 April 2021. Lam was arrested in January 2021 under the National Security Lawfor participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020.

charges.charge: Rioting
charges.incident: participating in a riot in Yuen Long on 21 July 2019

charges.charge: conspiring with others to damage property and obstructing the course of justice
charges.incident: Lam was arrested for participating in a protest on 6 July 2020 outside the Tuen Mun police station. Lam and others surrounded a man who might have been filming the protest. The man's phone as taken away by someone without consent.

charges.charge: Three counts of disclosing the identity of a person being investigated by the Independent Commission Against Corruption
charges.incident: Lam was accused of announcing at three press conferences between November 2019 and July 2020 that the ICAC was looking into then district commander Yau Nai-keung, in connection with the Yuen Long incident. Yau was assistant district commander (crime) in Yuen Long at the time of the attacks.
charges.sentencing: Four months of jail time for each conviction to be served concurrently. Deducting time served and time in custody, Lam was granted bail as he awaits appeal against the conviction. He remains in custody.

charges.charge: National Security Law - conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 林卓廷
zh_HK.summary: 香港政治人物，前北區區議員及前任民主黨副主席，曾任民主黨總幹事、廉政公署前調查主任。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯港區國安法而被捕，2月底開始被還押至今。林卓廷因被囚無法履行職務，於2021年3月及5月分別辭去北區區議員及民主黨副主席職務。

name: Dr. Kwok Ka-ki
title: Former member, Hong Kong Legislative Council; Former member of central and western District Council; Former member, Civic Party
summary: Kwok Ka-ki was a former member of the Hong Kong Legislative Council in which he served three terms as a member for the Medical functional constituency, New Territories West and the Central and Western District Council between 2004 and 2020. He was a member of the Civic Party since 2010. He is also a private urology doctor in Hong Kong. Kwok was one of the four high-profile Civic Party members who were disqualified from the Legislative Council in November 2020. The disqualification was ordered by the National People’s Congress Standing Committee. He was arrested in January 2021 under the National Security Law for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020. He then resigned from the Civic Party during his lengthy bail hearings in March 2021, followed by the disbanding of the Party in April 2021.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 郭家麒
zh_HK.summary: 香港政治人物，香港泌尿外科專科醫生，祖籍廣東省揭陽，於香港土生土長，曾任香港香港立法會新界西地區直選議員以及前公民黨健康及生活質素支部主席。與妻子許舜莉育有一子兩女。2020年11月11日，全國人大常委會作出決定，制訂涉及取消立法會議員資格的框架安排，授權特區政府處理有關事宜，並由特區政府宣佈他即時喪失立法會議員資格。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底一直還押至今。

name: Lester Shum Ngo-fai
title: Former member, Tsuen Wan District Council; Former deputy secretary-general, Hong Kong Federation of Students
summary: Lester Shum Ngo-fai was born in New York in the United States. He moved to Hong Kong in the mid-1990s. He studied Government and Public Administration at the Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK). Shum was the vice president of the Student Union at CUHK from 2013 to 2014, after that he served as deputy secretary-general of the Hong Kong Federation of Students between 2014 and 2015. He was the one of the leaders of the 2014 Umbrella Movement. Shum’s political career started when he became an assistant to former lawmaker Eddie Chu Hoi-dick in 2016. He was later elected as a member of the Hoi Bun constituency in Tsuen Wan district in 2019. He was disqualified from the Legislative Council in July 2020 after taking part in the pro-democracy primaries took place. He was later arrested in January 2021 and charged with subversion along with 46 activists and politicians in February 2021. Alongside activist Joshua Wong, district councillors Jannelle Rosalynne Leung and Tiffany Yuen, Lester was charged with taking part in an unauthorized assembly (the Hong Kong’s annual June 4th candlelight vigil) in Causeway Bay in 2019 and was sentenced to six months in prison on 6th May 2021.

charges.charge: participating in unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Candlelight Vigil on 4 June 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 岑敖暉
zh_HK.summary: 前朱凱廸新西團隊成員、香港專上學生聯會成員，前荃灣區議會海濱選區議員；曾擔任香港中文大學學生會幹事會外務副會長及香港專上學生聯會副秘書長。2020年，宣布將會放棄美國國籍，參選立法會[4]。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底被拒保釋一直還押至今。

name: Alvin Yeung Ngok-kiu
title: Former member, Hong Kong Legislative Council; Former leader, Civic Party
summary: Alvin Yeung is a Hong Kong barrister and the leader of the Civic Party. He served as the member of Hong Kong’s Legislative Council from 2016 - 2020, representing the New Territories East constituency. On 11 November 2020, he was disqualified by Beijing from the Legislative Council, along with three other pro-democracy lawmakers. The disqualification led to the mass resignation of pan-democratic lawmakers. He was arrested in January 2021 on suspicion of “subversion of state” under the National Security Law for participating in the “35+” democratic primaries. He has been detained for more than two months now.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 楊岳橋
zh_HK.summary: 香港執業大律師，前公民黨黨魁，曾任香港立法會議員。2020年11月11日，全國人大常委會作出決定，制訂涉及取消立法會議員資格的框架安排，授權特區政府處理有關事宜，並由特區政府宣布他已於2020年7月30日喪失立法會議員資格。2021年1月6日因早前參與民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，正被扣押。

name: Sam Cheung Ho-sum
title: District Councillor, San Hui District
summary: Sam Cheung is the current District Councillor representing the San Hui District and a member of the Tuen Mun Community Network. He ran in the “35+” democratic primaries within the New Territories West constituency and came in second. In January 2021, he was arrested on suspicion of “subversion of state” under the National Security Law and has been in custody since then.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 張可森
zh_HK.summary: 曾加入屯門社區網絡，前香港屯門區議會新墟選區議員，亦曾擔任過屯結新墟創辦人等職務。因民主派初選案被關押，2021年5月11日正式辭任區議員職務。

name: Frankie Fung Tat-chun
summary: Frankie Fung participated in the District Council election in 2019 for Lung Shing district. He is the founder of the online media outlet DB Channel and convenor of political group Peninsular Commons. He participated in the “35+” democratic primaries for the Kowloon West constituency and was arrested in January 2021 on suspicion of “subversion of state” under the National Security Law. He has been detained for over two months since then.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 馮達浚
zh_HK.summary: 香港九龍城大小事主席，半島連線召集人，龍城社區主任，2020年香港立法會選舉民主派初選九龍西選區參選人。畢業於馬頭涌官立小學（紅磡灣）及拔萃男書院，香港浸會大學傳理學院。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底一直還押至今。

name: Nathan Lau Chak-fung
title: Former President, Hong Kong Shue Yan University Student Council
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Nathan Lau is a student activist, a former President of the Hong Kong Shue Yan University Student Council and a former member of the Hong Kong Federation of Students. He participated in the “35+” democratic primaries and was arrested in January 2021 on suspicion of “subversion of state”.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 劉澤鋒
zh_HK.summary: 香港社運人士，前學聯抗爭者支援基金主席，前樹仁大學學生會會長。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，一直還押至今。

name: Eddie Chu Hoi-dick
title: Activist; Former member, Legislative Council; Founder, Local Action
summary: Eddie Chu was a former LegCo member between 2016 and 2020. After graduating from the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 1999, he studied Persian language at the Tehran University and worked as a news editor and reporter in Iran. He was actively involved in cultural conservation and environmental issues in Hong Kong and founded an activist group called Local Action. Since 2006, he had led conservation campaigns to protect historical and rural sites in Hong Kong including the Star Ferry Pier, Choi Yuen Village and North East New Territories New Development areas. He resigned from the Legislative Council in 28 September 2020. He was arrested in November along with six other democrats, in connection with the melee that had broken out in the LegCo in May. Chu was arrested for his alleged organization and participation in the unauthorized 1 July march in Wanchai the same year. Chu was one of the 53 pro-democracy politicians who got arrested under the National Security Law in January 2021. He was accused of alleged subversion in connection with unofficial primary elections.

charges.charge: Contempt
charges.incident: Chu threw bio-fertiliser on the floor of the chamber on June 4 2020 during an Legislative Council meeting in attempt to disrupt the passage of the national anthem bill.

charges.charge: Knowingly participating in an unauthorized assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Vigil in 2020

charges.charge: organising and knowingly participating in an unauthorized assembly
charges.incident: protest against the national security law on 1 July 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 朱凱廸
zh_HK.summary: 前香港民主派立法會議員（新界西），社會運動活躍人士，左翼環境保護主義者，是前朱凱廸新西團隊成員，就任立法會議員時期加入民主派立法會黨團議會陣線運作。在反對清拆皇后碼頭行動中，朱凱廸曾是本土行動的成員，代表該組織向大眾介紹文物保育、城市規劃民主化的重要性而為人熟悉，並且長期關注新界的鄉郊發展。他也是菜園村關注組成員，是反高鐵運動的中堅人物。2021年2月28日，因早前參與2020年立法會選舉民主派初選被特區政府指控涉嫌干犯「串謀顛覆國家政權」罪而被捕被及起訴，一直不獲國安法指定裁判官批准保釋而被還押至今。

name: Carol Ng Man-yee
title: Former chairwoman - Confederation of Trade Unions (CTU), British Airways Hong Kong International Cabin Crew Association (BAHKICCA); Former general secretary, Hong Kong Cabin Crew Federation (HKCCF)
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Carol is no stranger to a lot of Hong Kongers. She was the chairwoman of the Confederation of Trade Unions and the British Airways Hong Kong International Cabin Crew Association. She had served British Airways as a flight attendant for 30 years and a mother of two. Carol led the BNHKICCA and was successful in fighting for the rights of employees including extending the retirement age from 45 to 65 for foreign crews after several years in the courts since 2007. In 2016, she led the first HKCCF’s protest taking on former chief executive of Hong Kong Leung Chun-ying over the handling of a piece of left luggage belonging to his daughter. As a result, 2,500 people showed up at the airport to support the federation and in 2018. After a judicial review made by the federation, the High Court judge ruled that the decisions made by the Airport Authority and the security company were contrary to the regulations set out in the Hong Kong Aviation Security Programme. The court also made a declaration in favour of the judicial review applicant, and ordered the Airport Authority and the security company to pay costs. Ng was one of the candidates who were arrested under the National Security Law for her participation in the 35+ pro-democracy primaries in July 2021. Her case was raised in the Parliament by John McDonnell MP and he asked the UK Government to “call upon Chinese authorities to halt the prosecution and secure her release”.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 吳敏兒
zh_HK.summary: 前香港職工會聯盟主席，前工黨黨員，過去多年一直積極參與勞工運動，其中包括「行李門」事件、成立英航工會等。[3]2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底開始被還押至今。

name: Ng Kin-wai
title: Social activist; Former member, District Council; Convenor, Tin Shui Wai Connection
summary: Ng Kin-wai is a social activist. In 2019, he ran against a pro-Beijing incumbent and won the election for Yuen Long District Council and became a district Councillor of the Kingswood North Constituency. In July 2020, he ran in the 35+ democratic primaries in the New Territories West constituency and came in fourth by receiving 20,525 votes. In January 2021, Ng was arrested under the National Security Law for his participation in the primaries in July 2020. In May 2021, Ng was charged with ‘prohibited group gathering’ for his organization of the protest to urge the Hong Kong Police to investigate the ‘7.21 Yuen Long Attacks’ incident on 19 July 2020. He pleaded guilty and was ordered to pay a fine for HKD10,000.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 伍健偉
zh_HK.summary: 天水連線成員，前元朗區議會嘉湖北選區議員，於2019年香港區議會選舉以165票之差擊敗原任親建制派區議員李月民。因民主派初選案被關押，2021年5月10日辭任區議員職務。

name: Henry Wong Pak-yu
title: Former member, District Council; Spokesman, Tin Shui Wai New Force
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Henry Wong graduated from Hong Kong University of Science and Technology with a Bachelor of Engineering degree. He became a District Councillor for the Tin Heng Constituency of the Yuen Long District Council in 2019. Wong was among the 53 members of the pro-democracy politicians who were arrested under the National Security Law in January 2021 for his participation in the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 王百羽
zh_HK.summary: 天水圍民生關注平台發言人，前任元朗區議會天恒選區區議員，畢業於香港科技大學計算機科學及工程學系。2021年1月，王百羽因35+初選案被捕，同年5月宣佈辭去區議員職務。

name: Roy Tam Hoi-pong
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
summary: Roy Tam Hoi-pong was elected as a District Council for the New Territories West constituency in 2015. He was a secondary school teacher before he started his political career. Tam is an environmentalist and advocate for animal welfare. He is an environmental science undergraduate of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. He founded two NGOs - Footprint in 2002 and Green Sense in 2006 to educate citizens about environmental issues in Hong Kong. Light pollution and shark-finning are among the issues successfully publicized by Green Sense. Tam was arrested in January 2021 for his participation in the “35+” democratic primaries last year. In April 2021, he announced on social media that he had resigned from his post as a District Councillor, saying that he has been unable to receive information since his arrest in January 2021 and he was unable to serve his residents in Ma Wan personally while in prison on remand.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 譚凱邦
zh_HK.summary: 香港中學教師、社會活動家、政治人物，前香港荃灣區議會馬灣選區議員。他是香港環保觸覺創辦人、現任總幹事及前主席及前新民主同盟成員。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，一直還押至今。

name: Gary Fan Kwok-wai
status: Currently remanded in custody, bail denied
title: Former member - Hong Kong Legislative Council, District Council; Former leading member, Democratic Party (reformist faction); Former convenor, Neo Democrats
summary: Gary Fan Kwok-wai is a graduate of San Francisco State University. He started his political career after returning to Hong Kong. Fan was first as a member of the Sai Kung District Council in 1999. He was then elected as a member of the Legislative Council in 2012. He took an anti-immigration stance in the council. In 2013, he and Claudia Mo formed ‘HK First’ to raise concerns and challenge the Hong Kong government’s immigration policies on allowing 150 mainland Chinese immigrants to enter Hong Kong daily which was claimed to be the ‘root of housing problem’ in Hong Kong. In January 2021, he was arrested in January 2021 for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020. He had resigned from his position as a District Councillor in March 2021.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 范國威
zh_HK.summary: 香港激進民主派政治人物，籍貫廣東惠州惠陽，新民主同盟及香港本土成員，已婚，育一女，前香港立法會議員（新界東選區）及前西貢區議會運亨選區議員。范國威是民主派一員，主張港人優先，不支持港獨及以暴力方式應對中港矛盾，從實際政策倡議，去捍衛本土權益，以滿足對香港民主、自由、人權、法治的追求。他的政治立場是自治派和中間偏左，曾在立法會上動議有關支持港人優先的議案，並在2018年1月勝出民主派初選，其後在2018年香港立法會補選於新界東選區勝出，重返立法會。2019年9月13日，被選舉主任剝奪參選資格的劉頴匡對立法會補選的選舉呈請勝訴，范國威被裁定並非妥為當選。其後，范國威向終審法院上訴，得以暫時保留立法會議員身份。最後，終審法院拒絕上訴申請，即時失去議席。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底開始被還押至今。

name: Andrew Wan Siu-kin
title: Former member, District Council, Hong Kong Legislative Council; Former vice chairman, Democratic Party
summary: Andrew Wan Siu-kin graduated from the City University of Hong Kong with a Bachelor degree of Social Science in Social Work in 1969. He also studied at the University of Essex from 2006 and graduated with Bachelor and Master of Arts in Sociology. Wan started his political career in 2002 as the assistant of former legislator Leung Yiu-chung. He was elected as member of the District Council twice in 2003 and 2007. He became the Vice Chairman of the Democratic Party in 2014. He was arrested in November 2020 in connection with the melee that had broken out in the Legislative Council in May 2020. He was then arrested in January 2021 for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020. He announced in May 2021 that he decided to resign from the Kwai Tsing District Council.

charges.charge: inciting others to take part in an unauthorised assembly and knowingly participating in an unlawful assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Vigil in 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 尹兆堅
zh_HK.summary: 香港民主派政黨民主黨籍政治人物，前民主黨副主席、前香港新界西選區立法會議員，以及前香港葵青區議會石蔭選區議員。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底被拒保釋一直還押至今。

name: Wu Chi-wai
summary: Wu Chi-wai received his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in economics from the University of Wisconsin in 1991. After he returned to Hong Kong, he started his political career as an assistant for Legislative Councillor Conrad Lam. He was elected as a member of the Urban Council in 1995 before it was demolished in 1999. He won a seat in the Wong Tai Sin District Council in 1999 and had served the King Fu Constituency until 2019. Wu was elected as a member of the Legislative Council (LegCo) in 2012 and 2016. He also became the chairman of the Democratic Party with 92 percent of the vote in 2016 when Emily Lau retired from both LegCo and the party leadership. In November 2020, 15 democratic lawmakers including Wu resigned en masse in protest against the dismissal of four of their colleagues from LegCo. Wu was arrested twice in 2020 for taking part in the melee that broke out in LegCo in May 2020 for allegedly inciting and taking part in an unauthorized assembly (the annual 7.1. march) in December 2020. In January 2021, he was arrested under the National Security Law for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020. While Wu was remanded in custody, his 92-year-old father passed away, but Correctional Services Department rejected Wu’s application to attend his father’s funeral and offered to allow him to watch the funeral online instead. Subsequently, a High Court judge granted Wu  short-term bail so that he could attend his father’s funeral. He stayed for only 40 minutes before he was escorted back to the Lai Chi Kok Reception Centre.

charges.charge: Participating in an unlawful assembly
charges.incident: June 4 vigil in 2020

charges.charge: inciting others to take part in an unauthorised assembly and knowingly participating in an unlawful assembly
charges.incident: Protest against the national security law on 1 July 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 胡志偉
zh_HK.summary: 曾任香港民建聯黃大仙區議會瓊富選區議員、香港九龍東選區香港立法會議員、民主派會議召集人。香港民主黨主席（2016－2020）

name: Ventus Lau Wing-hong
title: Politician; Convenor, Shatin Community Network; Founding convenor, Community Network Union
summary: Ventus Lau Wing-hong has been active in politics since he was a student. He was invited to join the pro-democracy Neo Democrats by his secondary school teacher Roy Tam Hoi-pong in early 2014. When he was studying in the Chinese University of Hong Kong, he founded the ‘CUHK Local Society’ dedicated to the promotion of greater autonomy of Hong Kong. He was also the community officer of Pok Hong in Sha Tin, dedicated to community services in the district. He ran for a seat in the Hong Kong Legislative Council in 2018 but was disqualified for the support he showed for an independent Hong Kong on his Facebook page. In 2019, he led a march to deliver letters to local G-20 consulates urging global intervention against the extradition bill. He was arrested in January 2021 for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 劉頴匡
zh_HK.summary: 香港本土民主派人士，曾就讀順德聯誼總會梁銶琚中學、香港中文大學善衡書院中國語言及文學系。在校期間曾任香港中文大學善衡書院學生會代表會主席，而且創立攬抄本土派學生組織中大本土學社。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會激進民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底被拒保釋一直還押至今。

name: Jimmy Sham Tsz-kit
title: Activist; Member, District Council; Secretary, Rainbow of Hong Kong; Former convenor, Civil Human Rights Front
summary: Jimmy Sham Tsz-kit Sham was elected to the Sha Tin District Council during the 2019 District Council elections. He represents the pro-democracy League of Social Democrats in Lek Yuen constituency. Sham has been an activist for LGBT rights and pro-democracy movements in the city. He served in the pro-democracy organization Civil Human Rights Front and the LGBT rights organization Rainbow of Hong Kong. He is also a member of the League of Social Democrats. He took part in major protests in Hong Kong including the Occupy Central protest and the annual 7.1 March. He was arrested after the annual 7.1 March in 2011 for participating in unlawful assembly. He suffered head injuries from several attacks by masked men with hammers and iron tubes during the protests in 2019 and 2020. In August 2020, he was disqualified from the legislative council elections by the Hong Kong government after the government announced to postpone the elections due to the pandemic. Sham was named by the Time magazine as one of '20 people to watch' in 2020. He was the only Hong Kong citizen on the list. He was arrested in January 2021 for participating in an unofficial election primary which was held in July 2020.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 岑子杰
zh_HK.summary: 曾任香港民間人權陣線召集人，前香港沙田區議會瀝源選區議員，香港彩虹執行幹事，社會民主連線副主席。2020年英國《泰晤士報》選出全球20名值得關注人物，岑子杰作為民間人權陣線召集人當選為其中之一，是唯一入選的香港人。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕，2月底開始被還押至今。

name: Kinda Li Ka-tat
title: Former member, District Council; Founder, Civic Autonomy Power
summary: Kinda Li Ka-tat is a graduate of the University of Hong Kong. He was a registered social worker before becoming a member of the Kwun Tong District Council in 2019. He set up a local group ‘Civic Autonomy Power’ with other social work students to serve the Sau Mau Ping community in 2014. Li was arrested in January 2021 for his participation in the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020 and while he was remanded in custody, he resigned from the District Council in April 2021.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 李嘉達
zh_HK.summary: 前香港觀塘區議會協康選區議員。李嘉達於中國大陸出生，後隨家人移民香港，於香港大學社會工作學系畢業後成為註冊社工。李嘉達自中學時期開始接觸戲劇表演活動，並創立青年劇團「戲同行」，於在學及在職期間自編自導多部舞台劇。

name: Winnie Yu Wai-ming
title: Nurse; Activist; Founder and former chairwoman, Hospital Authority Employees Alliance
summary: Winnie Yu Wai-ming is a nurse. She volunteered as a paramedic during the Occupy protest, Mong Kok protest, the anti-extradition protest and a Covid-19 related labour strike between 2014 and 2020. The Hospital Authority Employees Alliance was founded to call for a city-wide strike to pressure the government during the 2019 anti-extradition protest. Yu became the chairwoman for the alliance. She was instrumental in organizing the labour strike in February 2020 to demand full border closure in response to the COVID-19 outbreak in Hong Kong. Yu was arrested in January 2021 for her participation in the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020. Yu was arrested on on 7 March 2022 on suspicion of violating her bail conditions by making comments online that could endanger national security. She was released on bail last July after being charged with conspiracy to subvert state power over an unofficial primary election for the Legislative Council in 2020. Yu's bail conditions include refraining from all acts and speeches that could endanger national security, including taking interviews, as well as running, organising and coordinating any elections. She was detained when she reported back to the Sha Tin Police Station.

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 余慧明
zh_HK.summary: 香港本土派人物，已解散的醫管局員工陣線前主席。在2019冠狀病毒病香港疫情相關爭議的醫護罷工行動而聞名。2021年1月6日因早前參與立法會民主派初選涉嫌違犯中華人民共和國香港特別行政區維護國家安全法而被捕；一直還押至7月28日，獲高等法院批准保釋。直至2022年3月7日因保釋期間發佈的Facebook帖文被認為危害國家安全及違反法庭保釋條件再次被捕並被撤銷保釋再度還押。

name: Gwyneth Ho Kwai-lam
status: Currently in jail for a total of 6 months of imprisonment
summary: Gwyneth Ho Kwai-lam is a journalist. She obtained a master degree in Journalism through the Erasmus Mundus Programme at the University of Amsterdam. She had previously worked for Radio Television Hong Kong (RTHK) and various media outliers including the BBC, the Reporter and Stand News. Ho became a prominent frontline reporter during the 2019 pro-democracy protest in Hong Kong. She was one of the reporters inside the Legislative Council Complex when protesters stormed into the building in July 2019. She was also present in the 7.21 Yuen Long MTR attack and was live-streaming the incident and in the end got attacked and suffered from minor injuries. Her video footage went viral. She was arrested in January 2021 for her participation in the “35+” democratic primaries in July 2020.

charges.charge: Knowingly participating in an unauthorized assembly
charges.incident: June 4th Vigil in 2020

charges.charge: National Security Law - Conspiracy to commit subversion
charges.incident: organising and participating in unofficial primary elections for Legislative Council in July 2020

zh_HK.name: 何桂藍
zh_HK.summary: 涉於民主派初選47人案被控「串謀顛覆國家政權」罪的何桂藍，還押逾半年，她早前向高等法院申請保釋，排期周三（8日）處理。她的代表律師基於法官拒絕撤銷法律程序報道限制，遂代表何桂藍撤銷保釋申請。何桂藍繼續還押候審。

name: Andy Li Yu-hin
summary: Andy Li is a pro-democracy activist. He was first arrested on suspicion of “collusion with foreign forces” under the National Security Law in August 2020. Alongside 11 others Hong Kong protesters, Andy was arrested by the Chinese authorities on August 23rd 2020 and later on charged by the mainland authorities with “illegal border crossing” and served seven months in jail before being handed over back to Hong Kong on March 22nd 2021. It was reported by Apple Daily that he is being held in solitary confinement at the maximum-security Siu Lam Psychiatric Center and monitored by “secret-units” of the government.

charges.charge: Conspiracy to commit collusion with a foreign country or with external elements to endanger national security
charges.incident: Accused of conspiring with Jimmy Lai and Finn Lau between July 2020 and February 2021 to lobby external forces to impose sanctions on Hong Kong and China

zh_HK.name: 李宇軒
zh_HK.summary: 李宇軒曾於2019年11月以個人名義邀請英國、加拿大、斯洛伐克等10國的19名外國專家抵港監察2019年區議會選舉以確保選舉能公正進行。2020年810大搜捕中，李宇軒被拘捕，連同香港警務處國家安全處搜查壹傳媒大樓事件中被捕的黎智英、其蘋果日報同僚，另外兩位社運人士周庭及前學民思潮成員李宗澤，共10人被捕。

name: Tony Chung Hon-lam
status: Currently in jail for a total of 43 months of imprisonment
summary: Tony Chung is a pro-Hong-Hong-independence activist and the founder of a now-disbanded localist student organization Studentlocalism. He was the first political figure arrested on suspicion of violating the National Security Law.

charges.charge: Desecration of the Chinese flag and participating in an unlawful assembly
charges.incident: During a confrontation between pro-democracy and pro-government demonstrators on 14 May 2019, Chung snatched a national flag from government supporters, detaching it from its pole.

charges.charge: Secession under National Security Law and Money Laundering
charges.incident: Chung was accused of publishing social media posts that called for the public to join protests, to “get rid of Chinese colonial rule,” as well as posts stating the mission and manifesto of his group. Donors' funds were wired to Chung’s personal account.

zh_HK.name: 鍾翰林
zh_HK.summary: 前香港獨派人士，前「學生動源」召集人。

name: Tong Ying-kit
summary: Tong Ying-kit is the first person in Hong Kong to be tried under Hong Kong’s National Security Law without a jury. Tong was carrying a flag bearing the slogan “Liberate Hong Kong; revolution of our times” and riding a motorbike into a group of police during the annual 7.1 March in July 2020. He was arrested that day and was charged with incitement to secession and terrorism under the National Security Law. In February 2021, Tong’s legal team was informed by the court that his trial will be heard by three National Security Law judges instead of a jury. Tong then applied for a judicial review of the decision but was rejected. He has been remanded in custody for over 300 days since he was arrested and he has been repeatedly denied bail.

charges.charge: Inciting secession and terrorist activities
charges.incident: He was arrested after he drove a motorcycle with a flag reading “Liberate Hong Kong, revolution of our times” into three police officers during a demonstration in Wan Chai.

zh_HK.name: 唐英傑
zh_HK.summary: 唐英傑案係第一單被控告違反香港國家安全法嘅案。被告唐英傑曾經參與反逃犯條例修訂運動。2020年7月1號，港區國安法實施當日，香港示威者喺香港島舉行七一遊行。下晝大約一點半，銅鑼灣百德新街一帶有人羣集結。廿三歲嘅唐英傑喺灣仔揸著部插有「光復香港　時代革命」旗幟嘅電單車，衝埋去由防暴警察組成嘅防線，喺穿越防線期間有最少三個警員係受咗傷。警方喺7月1號以《港區國安法》拘捕咗10個人，只有唐英傑被落案起訴。

name: Chan Pui Man
title: Former associate publisher of Apple Daily
summary: Chan Pui-man, the former associate publisher of Apple Daily was arrested on June 16 2021 along with Next Digital executives and editors and was accused of conspiring with them to ask foreign powers. Chan was released on bail on June 18 after hours of detention. On July 21, police revoked her bail and she has been held in pre-trial detention at the Tai Lam Centre for Women since then. On October 12, Chan and other Next Digital executives appeared at the West Kowloon Magistrates’ Court, where their national security cases were adjourned to December 28. She pleaded not guilty. She faced a new charge of conspiracy to publish seditious publications alongside other Next Digital and Apple Daily executives. Her next hearing would be on 24 February, 2022 at the High Court, where the maximum penalty is life behind bars. On December 29, while she was detained, Chan was arrested on a separate case for being involved in publishing seditious publications for Stand News along with her husband Chung Pui-kuen, who was the editor in chief at Stand News.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 陳沛敏
zh_HK.summary: 香港記者及傳媒人，於1992年畢業於香港中文大學新亞書院工商管理系，其後擔任過《資本》雜誌月刊記者、《星島日報》港聞版記者以及《蘋果日報》港聞版高級記者、副採訪主任、總編輯、副社長。2021年6月17日，警方國安處以「串謀勾結外國或境外勢力危害國家安全罪」拘捕包括陳沛敏在內的多名《蘋果日報》高層，其後獲准保釋。2021年6月25日，陳沛敏辭任《蘋果日報》副社長。2021年12月29日，她於香港立場新聞高層大搜捕中被再次逮捕。

name: Cheung Kim Hung
title: Former Chief Executive of Next Digital
summary: Cheung Kim Hung, the Chief Executive of Next Digital, was arrested on August 10 2020 along with other Next Digital executives for offences including collusion with foreign powers and conspiracy to defraud. They were detained over the subletting of part of Next Digital’s offices to a consulting company, which the government alleged violated the terms of the media company’s land lease. He was arrested again on June 17 2021 during an Apple Daily raid conducted by more than 500 police officers. He was accused of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces along with other executives. He was denied bail in the West Kowloon Magistrates’ Courts. The first hearing would be held on February 24 in the High Court.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 張劍虹
zh_HK.summary: 2021年6月17日，警方國安處以涉嫌違反國安法拘捕壹傳媒及《蘋果》5名高層，包括壹傳媒行政總裁張劍虹。

name: Ryan Law Wai Kwong
title: Former Chief Editor of Apple Daily
summary: Ryan Law, the chief editor of Apple Daily, was arrested on June 17 2021 during an Apple Daily raid conducted by more than 500 police officers. Hei was accused of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces along with other executives. He was denied bail in the West Kowloon Magistrates’ Courts.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 羅偉光
zh_HK.summary: 前《蘋果日報》總編輯羅偉光，以及3間與該報相關的公司，被控“串謀勾結外國或境外勢力危害國家安全罪”。

name: Fung Wai Kong
title: Former senior editorial writer of Apple Daily
summary: Fung Wai-kong, the former senior editorial writer of Apple Daily, was believed to be leaving Hong Kong for the United Kingdom on June 27 2021 when he was arrested for conspiring to collude with foreign powers. The first hearing will be held on 24 February in the High Court Court.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 馮偉光 (盧峯)
zh_HK.summary: 1997年起在《蘋果日報》筆名盧峯撰寫社論，其後擔任《蘋果日報》英文版執行總編輯。馮偉光在香港國際機場準備搭機前往英國時，被香港警務處國家安全處以涉嫌勾結外國勢力的罪名拘捕。

name: Lam Man Chung
title: Former Executive Editor of Apple Daily
summary: Lam Man-chung, the former executive editor of Apple Daily, was arrested on July 21 2021. His house was searched on the same day. He had resigned from Apple daily after overseeing the publication of the newspaper’s last copy on June 24 2021. The first hearing will be held on 24 February in the High Court Court.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 林文宗
zh_HK.summary: 警務處國家安全處拘捕前《蘋果日報》執行總編輯林文宗，指他涉嫌串謀勾結外國或境外勢力危害國家安全。

name: Yeung Ching-kee
title: Former editorial writer and senior columnist of Apple Daily
summary: Yeung Ching-kee (also known as Lee Ping), an editorial writer for Apple Daily, was arrested on June 23 2021 for conspiring to collude with foreign powers. The first hearing will be held on 24 February in the High Court Court.

charges.charge: conspiracy to collude with foreign forces
conspiracy to publish in seditious publications

zh_HK.name: 楊清奇 (李平)
zh_HK.summary: 壹傳媒 6 名前高層，包括張劍虹、陳沛敏、羅偉光、林文宗、馮偉光及楊清奇，被控「串謀勾結外國或者境外勢力危害國家安全罪」

name: Tommy Yuen Man On
title: Pro-democracy activist, singer and former member of the Cantopop boy group E-kids
summary: Tommy Yuen Man On has been an activist supporting the pro-democracy camp over the past years and especially at the height of the 2019 social unrest. He participated in multiple pro-democracy protests and led the Human Rights Day Rally in December 2019. On social media, he was very critical of the Hong Kong and Chinese governments. On 15 February 2022, Yuen was arrested on suspicion of acting with seditious intent and money laundering. According to Senior Superintendent Steve Li of the National Security Department, Yuen’s social media posts formed the basis of the police’s enforcement actions. He said that “looking at these posts, the only conclusion we can make is that he hopes to incite citizens’ hatred of the government through such seditious language and photos.” He also performed a song containing the protest slogan “Liberate Hong Kong, revolution of our times” during an online concert. According to Li, the slogan “means separatism,” as mentioned in the Tong Ying-kit case, “if the guy sings this song … that would be inciting others to do some illegal acts.” On 17 February 2022, Yuen was officially charged on one count of committing an act or acts with seditious intention. He was transferred to the West Kowloon Magistrates’ Courts. Yuen’s application for bail was denied after Magistrate Andy Cheng Lim-chi concluded that there were insufficient grounds to believe that Yuen would not continue to commit acts endangering national security if bail was approved.

charges.charge: Acting with seditious intent
charges.incident: On his social media he cursed judges, made fun of police officers who died or were injured in the line of duty, and criticised government policies during the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic. He performed a song containing the protest slogan 'Liberate Hong Kong, revolution of our times' during an online concert.

zh_HK.name: 阮民安
zh_HK.title: 香港男歌手，為前男子組合E-kids成員
zh_HK.summary: 2019年8月3日，阮民安被電視台拍到參與反修例示威，他直認畫面中的銀髮男是他本人。同月23日他出席網民發起的「香港之路」活動及現身8月25日荃葵青大遊行，向香港政府表達訴求，後在Facebook發長文，題為〈我很窮，我愛人民幣，但我更愛香港〉，他與妻子的微博遭內地網民洗版，批評是港獨。同月，他不獲已經連續出席過4年的上海時裝周邀請，無法出席該活動，他指主辦方是因政治因素而做此決定，但強調自己不會因失去龐大內地市場收入減少而妥協，會轉攻其他地區的市場。

name: Koo Sze Yiu
title: Activist
summary: Koo is Hong Kong political activist. He has been in jail for 11 times.

charges.charge: attempting to do or making any preparation to do an act or acts with seditious intention
charges.incident: Koo was planning to demonstrate outside Beijing’s Liaison Office to protest Beijing's Winter Olympics.

zh_HK.name: 古思堯
zh_HK.summary: 香港街頭示威活躍份子、反共人士，曾11次入獄。

name: Alexandra Wong Fung-Yiu (Grandma Wong)
title: Veteran activist
summary: Alexandra Wong, who has regularly campaigned for full democracy for Hong Kong, could often be seen waving the Union Jack flag at demonstrations. Wong was charged with two counts of unlawful assembly from 2019, when millions had taken part in months of protracted pro-democracy protests. On 13 July 2022, Wong was sentenced to 8 months of imprisonment for unlawful assembly.

charges.charge: Unlawful assembly
charges.incident: Wong participated in pro-democracy protests from 2019

zh_HK.name: 王鳳瑤
zh_HK.summary: 人稱王婆婆、白髮婆婆、黃傘婆婆，香港社會運動人士。由於在反對逃犯條例修訂草案運動中的遊行與集會常常舉起英國國旗，因而吸引到香港群眾的注目。

name: Ma Chun-man (aka Captain America)
title: Activist
summary: Ma Chun Man was accused of publicly promoting slogans involving secession on the streets and in media interviews on many occasions. He was charged with inciting others to split the country in Hong Kong between August 15 and November 22, 2020. After a trial last year, he was convicted of inciting others to the subversion of state power and sentenced to 5 years and 9 months in prison. This case is the first appeal case involving the national security law, and it is of great importance.

charges.charge: “inciting subversion” under the national security law
charges.incident: chanting slogans and sharing his political views online

zh_HK.name: 馬俊文
zh_HK.summary: 香港被稱為“第二代美國隊長”的31歲男子馬俊文，因呼喊口號去年被裁定“煽動他人分裂國家”罪，被判監五年九個月。隨後他對刑期提出上訴。星期三（8月3日）獲上訴庭改判監禁五年。馬俊文是香港首位純粹因高喊或展示口號而受到違反“港版國安法”指控並被定罪的人士。

name: Lancelot Chan Wing-tai
title: Former member of the Siu Sai Wan constituency of the Hong Kong Eastern District Council
summary: A former pan-democracy district councillor was sentenced to 15 months in prison yesterday for inciting others to participate in an illegal assembly on July 1, 2020.

charges.charge: Incitement to knowingly take part in an unauthorized assembly
charges.incident: Inciting others to participate in an illegal assembly on July 1, 2020

zh_HK.name: 陳榮泰
zh_HK.summary: 陳榮泰被香港政府根據《基本法》第104條的解釋所訂下的原則及相關的法律規定，宣布其宣誓為無效宣誓而失去議員資格，結束一年餘的區議員任期。

name: Lui Sai Yu
title: Student at the Polytechnic University of Hong Kong
summary: Lui was accused of using his residence as an arsenal, collecting pepper balls, air guns and other items, and commenting on Hong Kong independence on the Telegram channel. At the original trial, he pleaded guilty to 'inciting subversion of state power' and two counts of unlicensed possession of firearms and possession of offensive weapons were filed in court. Regarding sentencing, the judge said that the case was 'serious' and that the defendant incited Hong Kong independence through Telegram channels. The defendant pleaded guilty and was sentenced to three years and eight months of imprisonment. The prosecution immediately suggested that the National Security Law includes the crime of 'inciting subversion of state power'. The minimum sentence for serious cases is five years in prison, and the judge finally commuted the sentence to 5 years after consideration. In other words, although the defendant pleaded guilty, he could not obtain a commutation of one-third of the sentence.

charges.charge: Inciting subversion of state power

zh_HK.name: 呂世瑜
zh_HK.summary: 理大男生呂世瑜被指 2020 年在 TG 頻道煽動港獨及售武煽暴，2022 年 4 月承認「煽動他人分裂國家」罪，原獲法庭由判囚 5 年半減刑至 3 年 8 個月。惟控方指，判刑受《國安法》罪行的最低刑期所限，情節嚴重者須「處 5 年以上」，法官胡雅文改判被告監禁 5 年。

name: Chow Hang-tung
title: Former Vice Chairman of the Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China
summary: Chow Hang-tung is the former vice-chairperson of the Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China. On 4 June 2021, Chow was arrested for allegedly publicizing a banned public assembly - the Tiananmen Massacre vigil. On 30 June 2021, Chow was re-arrested for inciting an illegal assembly, which was scheduled to take place on July 1. On 7 September 2021, Chow, along with Simon Leung, Tang Ngok-kwan and Chan To-wai, former committee members of the Hong Kong Alliance, were arrested after they publicly refused a police demand for information as part of a national security probe into the organisation.

charges.charge: inciting others to take part in an unauthorised assembly and knowingly participating in an unlawful assembly
charges.incident: June 4 vigil in 2020

charges.charge: inciting others to take part in an unauthorised assembly
charges.incident: June 4 vigil in 2021

charges.charge: failing to comply with police information request
charges.incident: Chow and her organisation failed to furnish national security officers with details about the group’s members, financial reports and activities.

zh_HK.name: 鄒幸彤
zh_HK.title: 香港大律師，前支聯會副主席。
zh_HK.summary: 香港區域法院判定鄒幸彤因為出現在2020年六四集會現場而犯有參與未經批准的集結罪以及非法煽惑他人參與。2022年1月4日被判入囚15個月，加上2021年12月已經因為其他案件被判囚，兩個案件的刑期部份同時執行，令她的總刑期增至22個月。鄒幸彤不服，提出上訴。2022年12月14日，高等法院法官張慧玲裁定鄒幸彤上訴得直，原有刑期獲撤銷。2023年6月8日，終審法院批准律政司申請上訴許可。

name: Wong Yat Chin
title: Former Convenor of 'Student Politicism'
summary: The prosecution listed seven street booths held by the defunct group with themes ranging from supporting the 12 Hongkongers captured by Chinese coastguards as they tried to flee to Taiwan, to resisting the government’s Covid-19 anti-epidemic measures. That is: From October 25, 2020, to June 16, 2021, conspiring with others in Hong Kong to incite others to organize, plan, carry out or Participate in the following acts aimed at subverting state power by force, the threat of use of force or other illegal means. Wong was also said to have sought to incite others to build a “Hong Kong nation” during his speeches at the street booths. The former convenor, according to the prosecution, also told the public to ensure “mental and physical preparation” for revolution.

charges.charge: Conspiracy to incite others to subvert state power
charges.incident: Conspiracy to incite subversion in acts between October 2020 and June 2021

zh_HK.name: 王逸戰
zh_HK.summary: 本土派人士，賢學思政召集人。他於2019年6月9日第一次參與遊行，並受到梁凌杰自盡激勵，開始投身社會運動。他多次因擺放街站及其他賢學思政的活動而被捕，亦曾多次被人跟蹤。另外，他也是少數在2020年港區國安法於香港立法後仍然堅持繼續擺設街站的社運人士之一。

name: Jessica Chu Wai-yin
title: Former Spokesperson of 'Students Politicism'
summary: The prosecution listed seven street booths held by the defunct group with themes ranging from supporting the 12 Hongkongers captured by Chinese coastguards as they tried to flee to Taiwan, to resisting the government’s Covid-19 anti-epidemic measures. That is: From October 25, 2020, to June 16, 2021, conspiring with others in Hong Kong to incite others to organize, plan, carry out or Participate in the following acts aimed at subverting state power by force, the threat of use of force or other illegal means.

charges.charge: Conspiracy to incite others to subvert state power
charges.incident: Conspiracy to incite subversion in acts between October 2020 and June 2021

zh_HK.name: 朱慧盈
zh_HK.summary: 前本土派學生組織賢學思政發言人、學生組織本土青年意志發言人。2021年9月佢同王逸戰、陳枳森同埋黃沅琳因為搞賢學思政，而被控「串謀煽動他人實施顛覆國家政權罪」。初時佢哋俾裁判法院拒絕保釋，需要還押。其後，朱慧盈喺2021年10月15號以現金1.5萬元保釋外出候訊，但唔可以喺社交網站發佈任何訊息、唔可以接受或者主持任何訪問、唔可以同任何外國官員會面等。

name: Yuen Ka-him
title: Members of 'RETURNING VALIANT', Student
status: Sentenced to detention in a training centre for 3 years
summary: The defendants were charged following events that occurred between January 10, 2021, and May 6, 2021. They allegedly promoted against China through online social media platforms, street speeches, leaflet distribution, press conferences, and live broadcasts. Incitement is alleged to have occurred through two different Instagram accounts and one Facebook account.

zh_HK.name: 阮嘉謙
zh_HK.title: 光城者
zh_HK.summary: 香港「光城者」7名成員涉嫌去年多次擺街站派發宣傳單，鼓吹「武裝起義」是推翻政府唯一出路，遭控國安法中「串謀煽動他人實施顛覆國家政權罪」。7人早前全數認罪，法官郭偉健8日上午在區域法院聽取求情後，判5名未成年被告入教導所，其餘2名被告押後至下月25日判刑。
